item.title: Prilly add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "This is how the entire course of a life can be changed: by doing nothing." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Prilly add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "Our love of each other was like two long shadows kissing without hope of reality." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Prilly add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "What's in store for me in the direction I don't take?" -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Prilly add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Prilly add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Prilly add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "The feelings we live through in love and in loneliness are simply, for us, what high tide and low tide are to the sea." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Prilly add a quote by Harlan Coben
item.description: "..."better to have loved and lost" bullshit. Don't show me paradise and then burn it down." -- Harlan Coben

item.title: Prilly add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "She feels in italics and thinks in CAPITALS." -- Henry James

item.title: Prilly add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "He was like a song I'd heard once in fragments but had been singing in my mind ever since." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: Prilly add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "If you have experienced an evening more exciting than any in your life, you're sad to see it end; and yet you still feel grateful that it happened." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: Prilly add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "Sometimes," he sighed, "I think the things I remember are more real than the things I see. " -- Arthur Golden
